question.title: Compile and test classes generated by Maven template engine project
question.body:
My Maven project is a template engine that generates some java classes from user input data (provided as a json file). It is simply composed of a top level module (myproject-parent, type pom) and a core module (myproject-core) containing the engine.

The engine is realised thanks to the "Apache FreeMarker" maven dependency.

The core module contains some unit tests that execute the engine and generate some classes. Now I would like to compile and import them into dedicated tests in order to check the accuracy of the generated code.

Can this be done directly in the core module through a dedicated phase or goal? Or eventually in a separate test module?

Ultimately, is it possible to package these generated classes with the rest of the project (as examples for user)?
